creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: irregular, rounded mountains; small pavilion at center; small waterfall at R; two groups of huts in middle ground at base of mountains; two figures fishing in boat at LR; figure crossing a bridge LRC; figure raking small piece of land near hut LLC
inscription:
日高門尚掩　樹暖雨初晴　独坐幽花落　間庭春草生　読書頗楽道　省事豈無情　性本憐微物　相馴鳥雀鳴 (?)

Poem: Seisho sanbō shū no. 15
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4], 字曰子徳 {azana iwaku Shitoku}; LLC red seal: 拙居 {sekkyo}
signed: 甲寅孟冬寫於高松客次并舊製图南海一布衣古道人 {kinoe-tora mōtō sha oite Takamatsu kyakuji narabini ％ seizu Nankai-ichi hōi Kodōjin} (October 1914, drawn at a Guestroom in Takamatsu and picturing an old work, One-of-the-Southern-Sea in Plain-Clothes Kodōjin)
title: Quiet Mountain on a Slow Day
